member.summary: The type of Token represented.

member.summary: The parameter for the OAuth callback confirmed

member.summary: The Windsor configuration ID prefix for signing providers

member.summary: The OAuth credentials prefix for the Authorization HTTP header

member.summary: RFC 3986 percent encoding escape sequence

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.Constants.ReservedParameterNames
member.summary: Parameter names that are reserved by OAuth

member.name: T:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionSources
member.summary: OAuthRequestExceptions may be thrown locally or be reconstructed and rethrown from a HTTP response.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionSources.Local
member.summary: local: The exception was thrown locally.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionSources.Remote
member.summary: remote: The exception was thrown remotely and reconstructed and rethrown here.

member.name: T:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthException
member.summary: OAuthException is the base type for all exceptions thrown by OAuth.

member.name: T:OAuth.Net.Common.IConsumer
member.summary: A consumer

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.IConsumer.Key
member.summary: The consumer key (this MUST be unique across all consumers)

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.IConsumer.Secret
member.summary: The consumer secret

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.IConsumer.Status
member.summary: The status of the consumer

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.IConsumer.FriendlyName
member.summary: The name of the consumer. Service providers may choose to expose this to users.

member.name: T:OAuth.Net.Common.ICallbackStore
member.summary: When a consumer obtains a request token they must provide an absolute URL to which the Service Provider will redirect the User back when Obtaining the User Authorization step is completed. The CallbackStore provides the mechanism to

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ICallbackStore.AddCallback(OAuth.Net.Common.IRequestToken,System.Uri)
member.summary: Appends a new callback to the store.
member.returns: true if the callbackUri is succesfully appended or false if there already exists a callbackUri for the token

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ICallbackStore.ContainsCallback(OAuth.Net.Common.IRequestToken)
member.summary: Determins if the store contains a callback for the supplied token.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ICallbackStore.RemoveCallback(OAuth.Net.Common.IRequestToken)
member.summary: Removes the callbackUri from the store for the supplied token. This method should be used to obtain the callback Uri when redirecting the user to ensure that it is removed from the store.
member.returns: The callback URI or null if none found.

member.name: T:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthResource
member.summary: An OAuthProtectedResponse is a facade for HttpWebResponse. Its response stream is read into a MemoryStream which can be replayed.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthResource.#ctor(System.Net.HttpWebResponse)
member.summary: Creates an OAuthProtectedResponse from a HttpWebResponse.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.GuidHelper.CreateGuid
member.summary: Creates a Guid which is guaranteed not to equal the empty Guid.
member.returns: A new non-empty Guid

member.name: T:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionProblemTypes
member.summary: The problem types used by the Problem Reporting extension. These are the legal values of the Problem property of OAuthRequestException.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionProblemTypes.VersionRejected
member.summary: version_rejected: The oauth_version isn't supported by the Service Provider.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionProblemTypes.ParameterAbsent
member.summary: parameter_absent: A required parameter wasn't received.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionProblemTypes.ParameterRejected
member.summary: parameter_rejected: An unexpected parameter was received.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionProblemTypes.TimestampRefused
member.summary: timestamp_refused: The oauth_timestamp value is unacceptable to the Service Provider.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionProblemTypes.NonceUsed
member.summary: nonce_used: The oauth_nonce value was used in a previous request, and consequently can't be used now.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionProblemTypes.SignatureMethodRejected
member.summary: signature_method_rejected: The oauth_signature_method is unacceptable to the Service Provider.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionProblemTypes.SignatureInvalid
member.summary: signature_invalid: The oauth_signature is invalid. That is, it doesn't match the signature computed by the Service Provider.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionProblemTypes.ConsumerKeyUnknown
member.summary: consumer_key_unknown: The oauth_consumer_key is unknown to the Service Provider.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionProblemTypes.ConsumerKeyRejected
member.summary: consumer_key_rejected: The oauth_consumer_key is permanently unacceptable to the Service Provider. For example, the Consumer may be black listed.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionProblemTypes.ConsumerKeyRefused
member.summary: consumer_key_refused: The oauth_consumer_key is temporarily unacceptable to the Service Provider. For example, the Service Provider may be throttling the Consumer.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionProblemTypes.TokenUsed
member.summary: token_used: The oauth_token has been consumed. That is, it can't be used any more because it has already been used in a previous request or requests.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionProblemTypes.TokenExpired
member.summary: token_expired: The oauth_token has expired. That is, it was issued too long ago to be used now.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionProblemTypes.TokenRevoked
member.summary: token_revoked: The oauth_token has been revoked. That is, the Service Provider has unilaterally decided it will never accept this token.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionProblemTypes.TokenRejected
member.summary: token_rejected: The oauth_token is unacceptable to the Service Provider. The reason is unspecified. It might mean that the token was never issued, or consumed or expired and then subsequently forgotten by the Service Provider.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionProblemTypes.PermissionUnknown
member.summary: permission_unknown: The User hasn't decided whether to permit this Consumer to access Protected Resources. Usually happens when the Consumer requests Access Token before the user completes authorization process.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionProblemTypes.PermissionDenied
member.summary: permission_denied: The User refused to permit this Consumer to access Protected Resources.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ITokenGenerator.CreateRequestToken(OAuth.Net.Common.IConsumer,OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthParameters)
member.summary: Create a new request token
member.param: The consumer for whom the token is to be created
The parameters that were sent in the request that created this token (both OAuth and additional parameters).
member.returns: A request token

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ITokenGenerator.CreateAccessToken(OAuth.Net.Common.IConsumer,OAuth.Net.Common.IRequestToken)
member.summary: Create a new access token
member.param: The consumer for whom the token is to be created
The request token being swapped for this access token
member.returns: An access token

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.RequestId.Timestamp
member.summary: The unix timestamp (number of seconds since Unix epoch)

member.summary: The nonce

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.RequestId.ConsumerKey
member.summary: The consumer key

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.RequestId.Token
member.summary: The consumer key

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.IIssuedToken.Status
member.summary: The status of the token

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.IAccessToken.RequestToken
member.summary: The request token exchanged for this access token.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthToken.#ctor(OAuth.Net.Common.TokenType,System.String,System.String,OAuth.Net.Common.IConsumer)
member.summary: Create a simple token received from a service provider.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthToken.#ctor(OAuth.Net.Common.TokenType,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create a simple token received from a service provider.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthToken.Serialize(OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthToken)
member.summary: Serializes a SimpleToken to a string representation.
member.returns: String serialization of the token

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthToken.Deserialize(System.String)
member.summary: De-serializes a SimpleToken from its serialized form.
member.returns: Token
member.exception: if is not a valid serialized form

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthToken.Type
member.summary: The token type

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthToken.Token
member.summary: The token

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthToken.Secret
member.summary: The token secret

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthToken.ConsumerKey
member.summary: The key of the consumer this token was issued to

member.name: T:OAuth.Net.Common.ISigningProvider
member.summary: A signing provider provides signature computation for a given algorithm (the signature method).

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ISigningProvider.CheckRequest(System.Web.HttpRequest)
member.summary: Checks the HTTP request satisfies any pre-conditions for the signing provider. For example, the signing provider may require a secure HTTP connection.
member.returns: True iff the request satisfies all pre-conditions

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ISigningProvider.ComputeSignature(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Computes a signature. The implementation will vary from provider to provider.
member.param: The signature base string (see OAuth Core 1.0 ยง9.1)
member.returns: A signature for the given signature base, consumer secret and token secret

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ISigningProvider.CheckSignature(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Checks the signature is a valid for the provided signatureBase. The implementation will vary from provider to provider.
member.param: The signature base string (see OAuth Core 1.0 ยง9.1)
member.returns: true if the signature provided is valid.

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.ISigningProvider.SignatureMethod
member.summary: The signature method that this signing provider provides

member.name: T:OAuth.Net.Common.UnixTime
member.summary: Class for converting to and from Unix (POSIX) time. Unix time is the number of seconds since the Unix epoch, 1970-1-1 0:0:00.0.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.UnixTime.ToUnixTime(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Converts a DateTime to unix time. Unix time is the number of seconds between 1970-1-1 0:0:0.0 (unix epoch) and the time (UTC).
member.param: The date time to convert to unix time
member.returns: The number of seconds between Unix epoch and the input time

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.UnixTime.FromUnixTime(System.Int64)
member.summary: Converts a long representation of a unix time into a DateTime. Unix time is the number of seconds between 1970-1-1 0:0:0.0 (unix epoch) and the time (UTC).
member.param: The number of seconds since Unix epoch (must be >= 0)
member.returns: A DateTime object representing the unix time

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.IRequestToken.AssociatedParameters
member.summary: The parameters that were sent in the request that created this token (both OAuth and additional parameters).

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.IRequestToken.AuthenticatedUser
member.summary: The identity of the user who has authenticated against this token

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.IRequestToken.Roles
member.summary: The roles of the user who has authenticated against this token

member.name: T:OAuth.Net.Common.IRequestIdValidator
member.summary: Stores information about previous requests to validate future timestamps and nonces.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.IRequestIdValidator.CheckRequest(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Checks that the timestamp is valid and that the nonce has not been used before by the same consumer, according to the timestamp/nonce policies of the implementation.
Throws an OAuthRequestException if there is a problem with the nonce or timestamp.
member.returns: A RequestId (formed of the timestamp, nonce and consumer key) if the request is ok

member.name: T:OAuth.Net.Common.INonceProvider
member.summary: A nonce is a random string, uniquely generated for each request

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.INonceProvider.GenerateNonce(System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates a nonce that is unique for a particular timestamp.
member.returns: A nonce

member.name: T:OAuth.Net.Common.Rfc3986
member.summary: Performs RFC 3986 encoding and decoding. http://www.apps.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3986.html

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.Rfc3986.EncodeAndJoin(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Join the name-value pairs into a string seperated with ampersands. Each name and value is first RFC 3986 encoded and values are separated from names with equal signs.
member.param: The name value collection to encode and join
member.returns: An RFC 3986 compliant string

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.Rfc3986.SplitAndDecode(System.String)
member.summary: Splits a ampersand-separated list of key-value pairs, decodes the keys and values, and adds them to a NameValueCollection. Keys and values are separated by equals signs.
member.returns: A name value collection, which may be empty.
member.exception: If the string is not a series of key-value pairs separated by ampersands, or if one of the keys is null or empty, or if one of the keys or values is not properly encoded.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.Rfc3986.Encode(System.String)
member.summary: Perform RFC 3986 Percent-encoding on a string.
member.returns: The RFC 3986 Percent-encoded string

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.Rfc3986.Decode(System.String)
member.summary: Perform RFC 3986 Percent-decoding on a string.
member.returns: The decoded string

member.name: T:OAuth.Net.Common.ConsumerStatus
member.summary: The status of a consumer

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.ConsumerStatus.Unknown
member.summary: The status is unknown

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.ConsumerStatus.Valid
member.summary: The consumer is valid

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.ConsumerStatus.TemporarilyDisabled
member.summary: The consumer is temporarily disabled. For example, the consumer may be being throttled

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.ConsumerStatus.PermanentlyDisabled
member.summary: The consumer is permanently disabled.

member.name: T:OAuth.Net.Common.IVerificationProvider
member.summary: A verification code that is generated when the user has authenticated the Request Token. This code is provided in the callback Uri if the user is in-bound or must be displayed to the user to enter at the consumer to inform them that authorization is complete.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.IVerificationProvider.Generate(OAuth.Net.Common.IRequestToken)
member.summary: Generates a verifier code for the provided token. The provider must ensure that this token can be re-generated in a non-guessable manner or store the generated verification in a store.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.IVerificationProvider.IsValid(OAuth.Net.Common.IRequestToken,System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the verifier is valid for the Request Token provided.

member.name: T:OAuth.Net.Common.TokenStatus
member.summary: The status of a token

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.TokenStatus.Unknown
member.summary: The status is unknown

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.TokenStatus.Unauthorized
member.summary: The token is valid but unauthorized

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.TokenStatus.Authorized
member.summary: The token is valid and authorized

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.TokenStatus.Used
member.summary: The token has been used and cannot be used again

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.TokenStatus.Expired
member.summary: The token has expired. It was issued too long ago to be used now.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.TokenStatus.Revoked
member.summary: The token has been revoked.

member.name: T:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionParameters
member.summary: The parameters used by the Problem Reporting extension. These are used by OAuthRequestException.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionParameters.Problem
member.summary: oauth_problem: Parameter for the problem type.
member.remarks: The value must be one of the predefined problem types, although a Consumer SHOULD be prepared to receive other values, from a Service Provider that implements a future version of problem reporting.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionParameters.AcceptableVersions
member.summary: oauth_acceptable_versions: Parameter for the range of acceptable versions.
member.remarks: Applicable to the version_rejected problem type.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionParameters.AcceptableTimestamps
member.summary: oauth_acceptable_timestamps: Parameter for the range of acceptable timestamps.
member.remarks: Applicable to the timestamp_refused problem type.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionParameters.ParametersAbsent
member.summary: oauth_parameters_absent: Parameter for the OAuth parameters that were absent from the request.
member.remarks: Applicable to the parameter_absent problem type.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionParameters.ParametersRejected
member.summary: oauth_parameters_rejected: Parameter for the OAuth parameters whose values were rejected.
member.remarks: Applicable to the parameter_rejected problem type.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestExceptionParameters.ProblemAdvice
member.summary: oauth_problem_advice: Parameter for advice about the problem to be displayed to the user.
member.remarks: It SHOULD describe the problem in a way that's meaningful to the User, and suggest how to resolve the problem. The Consumer MUST NOT interpret it as HTML or any other markup language; all the characters MUST be displayed to the user. To indicate a line break, the single character LF (Unicode U+000A) MUST be used.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ResultInfo`1.op_True(OAuth.Net.Common.ResultInfo{`0})
member.summary: Checks whether the result info evaluates to true.
member.returns: True, iff result.Success == true

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ResultInfo`1.op_False(OAuth.Net.Common.ResultInfo{`0})
member.summary: Checks whether the result info evaluates to false.
member.returns: True, iff result.Success == false

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ResultInfo`1.op_LogicalNot(OAuth.Net.Common.ResultInfo{`0})
member.summary: Logical negation operator. Returns a result info with the Success value flipped.
member.returns: A new result info with the same data but with the success flag flipped

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ResultInfo`1.op_BitwiseAnd(OAuth.Net.Common.ResultInfo{`0},OAuth.Net.Common.ResultInfo{`0})
member.summary: Logical and operator. Returns a result info with the Success value set to left.Success and right.Success and the data set to default(T)
member.returns: A new result info with the Success value set to the result of left.Success and right.Success, and the data set to default(T)

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ResultInfo`1.op_BitwiseOr(OAuth.Net.Common.ResultInfo{`0},OAuth.Net.Common.ResultInfo{`0})
member.summary: Logical or operator. Returns a result info with the Success value set to left.Success || right.Success and the data set to default(T)
member.returns: A new result info with the Success value set to the result of left.Success || right.Success, and the data set to default(T)

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ResultInfo`1.op_Equality(OAuth.Net.Common.ResultInfo{`0},OAuth.Net.Common.ResultInfo{`0})
member.summary: Logical equality operator. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the left and right Success values are the same. The data is ignored for the comparison.
member.returns: True, iff left.Success == right.Success

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ResultInfo`1.op_Inequality(OAuth.Net.Common.ResultInfo{`0},OAuth.Net.Common.ResultInfo{`0})
member.summary: Logical inequality operator. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the left and right Success values are different. The data is ignored for the comparison.
member.returns: True, iff left.Success != right.Success

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ResultInfo`1.op_Implicit(OAuth.Net.Common.ResultInfo{`0})~`0
member.summary: Implicit conversion to type T.
member.returns: The data stored in the result info

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.IConsumerStore.Add(OAuth.Net.Common.IConsumer)
member.summary: Adds the supplied consumer to the consumer store. If the consumer conflicts with a consumer already in the store, then false is returned.
member.returns: true, iff the consumer was stored

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.IConsumerStore.Contains(System.String)
member.summary:
Checks whether the store contains a consumer with the given consumer key.
This will return true even if the consumer has a status other than Valid.
member.returns: true, iff there is such a consumer in the store

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.IConsumerStore.GetByKey(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the consumer registered with the given consumer key.
member.returns: The consumer registered with the consumer key if successful, or null if there is no consumer registered with the supplied key

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.IConsumerStore.Update(OAuth.Net.Common.IConsumer)
member.summary: Updates the given consumer in the store.
member.returns: true, iff the consumer was successfully updated in the store

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.IConsumerStore.Remove(OAuth.Net.Common.IConsumer)
member.summary: Removes the specified consumer from the store.
member.returns: true, iff the consumer was successfully removed from the store. This will return false if the consumer did not exist in the store.

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.IConsumerStore.Consumers
member.summary: Gets all the consumers in the store.

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.IConsumerStore.Count
member.summary: The number of consumers held in the store

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ITokenStore.Add(OAuth.Net.Common.IRequestToken)
member.summary: Adds the supplied request token to the token store. If the token conflicts with a token already in the store, then false is returned.
member.returns: true, iff the token was stored

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ITokenStore.Add(OAuth.Net.Common.IAccessToken)
member.summary: Adds the supplied access token to the token store. If the token conflicts with a token already in the store, then false is returned.
member.returns: true, iff the token was stored

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ITokenStore.Contains(System.String)
member.summary:
Checks whether the store contains ANY token with the given token string.
This will return true even if the token has a status other than Valid.
member.returns: true, iff there is such a token in the store

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ITokenStore.ContainsRequestToken(System.String)
member.summary:
Checks whether the store contains a request token with the given token string.
This will return true even if the token has a status other than Valid.
member.returns: true, iff there is such a token in the store

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ITokenStore.ContainsAccessToken(System.String)
member.summary:
Checks whether the store contains an access token with the given token string.
This will return true even if the token has a status other than Valid.
member.returns: true, iff there is such a token in the store

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ITokenStore.GetRequestToken(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the request token with the given token from the store. Returns null if there is no such token in the store.
member.returns: The token matching the inputs, or null if no such token exists in the store

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ITokenStore.GetAccessToken(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the request token with the given token from the store. Returns null if there is no such token in the store.
member.returns: The token matching the inputs, or null if no such token exists in the store

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ITokenStore.GetTokensByUser(System.Security.Principal.IIdentity)
member.summary: Gets an array of request AND access tokens associated with a given user.
member.returns: An array of request AND access tokens, or null if no tokens are associated with the user

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ITokenStore.GetTokensByUser(System.Security.Principal.IIdentity,System.String)
member.summary: Gets an array of request AND access tokens associated with a given user for a given consumer.
member.returns: An array of request AND access tokens, or null if no tokens are associated with the user

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ITokenStore.GetTokensByConsumer(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an array of request AND access tokens associated with a given consumer.
member.returns: An array of request AND access tokens, or null if no tokens are associated with the consumer

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ITokenStore.Update(OAuth.Net.Common.IRequestToken)
member.summary: Updates the the given request token in the store.
member.returns: true, iff the token was successfully updated in the store.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ITokenStore.Update(OAuth.Net.Common.IAccessToken)
member.summary: Updates the the given access token in the store.
member.returns: true, iff the token was successfully updated in the store.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ITokenStore.Remove(OAuth.Net.Common.IRequestToken)
member.summary: Removes the specified request token from the store.
member.returns: true, iff the token was successfully removed from the store. This will return false if the token did not exist in the store.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.ITokenStore.Remove(OAuth.Net.Common.IAccessToken)
member.summary: Removes the specified access token from the store.
member.returns: true, iff the token was successfully removed from the store. This will return false if the token did not exist in the store.

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.ITokenStore.Tokens
member.summary: Gets all the tokens in the store as an array.

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.ITokenStore.Count
member.summary: The total number of tokens held in the store

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.ITokenStore.RequestTokens
member.summary: Gets all the request tokens in the store as an array.

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.ITokenStore.CountRequestTokens
member.summary: The number of request tokens held in the store

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.ITokenStore.AccessTokens
member.summary: Gets all the access tokens in the store as an array.

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.ITokenStore.CountAccessTokens
member.summary: The number of access tokens held in the store

member.name: T:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestException
member.summary: An OAuthRequestException represents an OAuth protocol error. It is implemented using the Problem Reporting extension.

remarks.p: An OAuth exception can be serialized to a HTTP response using the parameters in the nested Parameters class.
OAuth exceptions that are sent with a HTTP response can be parsed and rethrown using the method.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestException.ThrowVersionRejected(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Throws an exception indicating that the oauth_version isn't supported.

remarks.para: The additional parameter (oauth_acceptable_versions) of the exception indicates the range of versions acceptable to the sender. That is, it means the sender will currently accept an oauth_version that's not less than the first number and not greater than the second number. A version A.B is considered greater than C.D if either A > C, or A = C and B > D.
The parameter, if supplied, will be stored in the property.

member.param: The minimum version of the OAuth protocol that is accepted
The maximum version of the OAuth protocol that is accepted
(Optional) Plain text advice for the user of the consumer
member.exception: If and/or is null or empty

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestException.ThrowParametersAbsent(System.String[],System.String)
member.summary: Throws an exception indicating that required parameter(s) weren't received.

remarks.para: The additional parameter (oauth_parameters_absent) of the exception indicates the set of parameter names that are absent, percent-encoded and separated by &.
The parameter, if supplied, will be stored in the property.

member.param: (Optional) Plain text advice for the user of the consumer

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestException.ThrowParametersRejected(System.String[],System.String)
member.summary: Throws an exception indicating unexpected parameter(s) were received.

remarks.para: The additional parameter (oauth_parameters_rejected) of the exception consists of a set of parameters, encoded as they would be in a URL query string. These are parameters that the sender recently received but doesn't understand. Note that these parameters will be percent-encoded twice: once to form a query string and again because the query string is the value of oauth_parameters_rejected.
The parameter, if supplied, will be stored in the property.

member.param: (Optional) Plain text advice for the user of the consumer

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestException.ThrowTimestampRefused(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.String)
member.summary: Throws an exception indicating that the timestamp was refused.

remarks.para: The additional parameter (oauth_acceptable_timestamps) of the exception consists of two numbers in decimal notation, separated by '-' (hyphen). It's the range of timestamps acceptable to the sender. That is, it means the sender will currently accept an oauth_timestamp that's not less than the first number and not greater than the second number.
The parameter, if supplied, will be stored in the property.

member.param: (Optional) Plain text advice for the user of the consumer

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestException.ThrowNonceUsed(System.String)
member.summary: Throws an exception indicating the nonce was used in a previous request, and consequently can't be used now

remarks.para: The parameter, if supplied, will be stored in the property.

member.param: (Optional) Plain text advice for the user of the consumer

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestException.ThrowSignatureMethodRejected(System.String)
member.summary: Throws an exception indicating the signature method is invalid.

remarks.para: The parameter, if supplied, will be stored in the property.

member.param: (Optional) Plain text advice for the user of the consumer

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestException.ThrowConsumerKeyUnknown(System.String)
member.summary: Throws an exception indicating the consumer key is unknown to the service provider.

remarks.para: The parameter, if supplied, will be stored in the property.

member.param: (Optional) Plain text advice for the user of the consumer

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestException.ThrowConsumerKeyRejected(System.String)
member.summary: Throws an exception indicating the consumer key is permanently unacceptable to the service provider. For example, the consumer may be blacklisted.

remarks.para: The parameter, if supplied, will be stored in the property.

member.param: (Optional) Plain text advice for the user of the consumer

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestException.ThrowConsumerKeyRefused(System.String)
member.summary: Throws an exception indicating the consumer key is temporarily unacceptable to the service provider. For example, the consumer may be being being throttled.

remarks.para: The parameter, if supplied, will be stored in the property.

member.param: (Optional) Plain text advice for the user of the consumer

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestException.ThrowSignatureInvalid(System.String)
member.summary: Throws an exception indicating the supplied signature is invalid. That is, it doesn't match the signature computed by the Service Provider.

remarks.para: The parameter, if supplied, will be stored in the property.

member.param: (Optional) Plain text advice for the user of the consumer

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestException.ThrowTokenRejected(System.String)
member.summary: Throws an exception indicating the supplied token is unacceptable to the service provider. The reason is unspecified. It might mean that the token was never issued, or consumed or expired and then subsequently forgotten by the service provider.

remarks.para: The parameter, if supplied, will be stored in the property.

member.param: (Optional) Plain text advice for the user of the consumer

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestException.ThrowTokenUsed(System.String)
member.summary: Throws an exception indicating the supplied token has been consumed. That is, it can't be used any more because it has already been used in a previous request or requests.

remarks.para: The parameter, if supplied, will be stored in the property.

member.param: (Optional) Plain text advice for the user of the consumer

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestException.ThrowTokenExpired(System.String)
member.summary: Throws an exception indicating the supplied token has expired. That is, it was issued too long ago to be used now.

remarks.para: The parameter, if supplied, will be stored in the property.

member.param: (Optional) Plain text advice for the user of the consumer

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestException.ThrowTokenRevoked(System.String)
member.summary: Throws an exception indicating the supplied token has been revoked. That is, the service provider has unilaterally decided it will never accept this token.

remarks.para: The parameter, if supplied, will be stored in the property.

member.param: (Optional) Plain text advice for the user of the consumer

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestException.ThrowPermissionDenied(System.String)
member.summary: Throws an exception indicating the consumer does not have the required permissions to acccess this resource

remarks.para: The parameter, if supplied, will be stored in the property.

member.param: (Optional) Plain text advice for the user of the consumer

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestException.TryRethrow(OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthParameters)
member.summary: Tries to parse an OAuthRequestException from some OAuth parameters. If an exception is indicated, the exception will be re-thrown.

remarks.para: If no exception is indicated, this method will return without throwing.
This will handle future Problem Reporting problem types, but not future additional parameters.

member.exception: If the OAuth parameters indicate an OAuth exception

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestException.ToHeaderFormat(System.String)
member.summary: Produces a string representation of the exception for use in the HTTP WWW-Authenticate header.
member.remarks:
The format is similar to:
OAuth realm="...", oauth_problem="..", oauth_parameters_absent=".."
member.param: The realm to put in the header
member.returns: The exception in WWW-Authenticate header format

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestException.ToString
member.summary: Create a string representation of the exception, including the problem, advice and additional parameter if present.
member.returns: String representation of the exception

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestException.Problem
member.summary: The problem type.
member.remarks: The value SHOULD be one of the problem types described in the Problem Reporting extension.

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestException.AdditionalParameter
member.summary: An optional additional key-value pair with extra problem reporting information.
member.remarks: This should be one of the extra parameters specified in the Problem Reporting extension.

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthRequestException.Advice
member.summary: An optional free-form text value to be shown to the User.
member.remarks: It SHOULD describe the problem in a way that's meaningful to the User, and suggest how to resolve the problem. The Consumer MUST NOT interpret it as HTML or any other markup language; all the characters MUST be displayed to the user. To indicate a line break, the single character LF (Unicode U+000A) MUST be used.

member.name: T:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthParameterSources
member.summary: Flags enumeration to indicate which sources should be used to collate OAuth parameters from. As this is a flags enumeration, different sources can be combined.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthParameterSources.None
member.summary: The parameters should be collated from none of the available sources. This should value not be used.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthParameterSources.HttpAuthorizationHeader
member.summary: The HTTP Authorization header should be used to collate parameters from.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthParameterSources.HttpPostBody
member.summary: The HTTP POST body should be used to collate parameters from (with a content-type of application/x-www-form-urlencoded)

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthParameterSources.HttpQueryString
member.summary: The HTTP query string should be used to collate parameters from.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthParameterSources.HttpWwwAuthenticateHeader
member.summary: The HTTP WWW-Authenticate header should be used to collate parameters from.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthParameterSources.ServiceProviderDefault
member.summary: Default sources for service providers are: the Authorization header, POST body and query string.

member.name: F:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthParameterSources.ConsumerDefault
member.summary: Default sources for consumers are: the WWW-Authenticate header and the POST body.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthParameters.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new empty OAuthParameters.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthParameters.Parse(System.Web.HttpRequest)
member.summary:
Parses the OAuth parameters from the HTTP request, sourcing parameters from all 3 of:
The HTTP Authorization header, if present
The POST body, if present and if the content-type is application/x-www-form-urlencoded
The query string, if present
TODO: Mention validation
member.returns: An OAuthParameters object containing the parsed reserved OAuth parameters and any additional, valid parameters

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthParameters.Parse(System.Web.HttpRequest,OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthParameterSources)
member.summary:
Parses the OAuth parameters from the HTTP request, sourcing parameters from the sources specified by .
TODO: Mention validation
member.param: The sources to collate parameters from (must not be OAuthParameterSources.None)
member.returns: An OAuthParameters object containing the parsed reserved OAuth parameters and any additional, valid parameters

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthParameters.Parse(System.Net.HttpWebResponse)
member.summary: Parses the OAuth parameters from a HttpWebResponse.
member.returns: An OAuthParameters object containing the parsed reserved OAuth parameters and any additional, valid parameters.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthParameters.Parse(OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthResource)
member.summary: Parses the OAuth parameters from a OAuthProtectedResponse.
member.returns: An OAuthParameters object containing the parsed reserved OAuth parameters and any additional, valid parameters.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthParameters.Parse(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Parses the OAuth parameters from a NameValueCollection
member.returns: An OAuthParameters object containing the parsed reserved OAuth parameters and any additional, valid parameters.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthParameters.GetNonOAuthParameters(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection[])
member.summary: Gets additional non-OAuth parameters from the specified name value collections.
member.param: The name value collections to source from
member.returns: A NameValueCollection containing all the additional parameters from the specified name value collections

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthParameters.RequireAllOf(System.String[])
member.summary: Validates that all the specified parameters are present and non-empty.
member.exception: If any of the required parameters are missing

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthParameters.AllowOnly(System.String[])
member.exception: If any parameters are not in the set of allowed parameters

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthParameters.RequireVersion(System.String[])
member.summary: Validates that the version matches one of the allowed versions.
member.param: The allowed version strings, in order from earliest to latest
member.exception: If the version does not match any of the allowed versions

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthParameters.OAuthRequestParams
member.summary: Returns a collection of the OAuth parameters that should be included within the HttpRequest. These are used when the OAuth parameters are sent in the querystring or the application/x-www-form-urlencoded body.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthParameters.ToNormalizedString(System.String[])
member.summary: Creates a normalized representation of the parameters for use in the signature base string.
member.param: Names of parameters to exclude from the normalized string.
member.returns: The signature-base normalized representation of the parameters.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Common.OAuthParameters.GetParam(System.String,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection[])
member.summary: Gets the specified parameter from one of the specified name value collections. The first value encountered is returned.
member.param: The name value collections to source from
member.returns: The first value for the parameter or null if it is not contained in any of the sources
